intro: Osmitopsis dentata, commonly known as the toothed osmitopsis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Osmitopsis dentata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
